H0.text: The Sun is losing mass and hydrogen as a result of transforming matter into energy through nuclear fusion.

H1.text: The Sun is losing volume and hydrogen, inferred from the fact that it transforms matter into energy through nuclear fusion.

H2.text: The Sun is losing mass and helium because it transforms matter into energy through nuclear fusion.

H3.text: The Sun is losing volume and helium because it transforms matter into energy through nuclear fusion.

A4.text: Every second, the Sun's core fuses about 600 billion kilograms of hydrogen into helium and converts 4 billion kilograms of matter into energy.

A5.text: The Sun has so far converted around 100 times the mass of Earth into energy, about 0.03% of the total mass of the Sun.
